answers.answer:
Asylum is a form of protection that allows a foreigner who cannot return to their country of origin to remain in Romania. Any foreigner who fears persecution, serious human rights violations, or armed conflict in their home country can apply for it.

For detailed information, please visit the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/applying-for-asylum and read the content under the "Applying for Asylum" section.
answers.bResponse:
Asylum is a form of protection that allows a foreigner who cannot return to their country of origin to remain in Romania. Any foreigner who fears persecution, serious human rights violations, or armed conflict in their home country can apply for it.

For detailed information, please visit the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/applying-for-asylum and read the content under the "Applying for Asylum" section. For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/applying-for-asylum

answers.answer:
Someone might seek asylum in Romania if they fear persecution, serious human rights violations, or armed conflict in their country of origin.

To find more detailed information, please visit the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/applying-for-asylum and read the section on "applying for asylum."

answers.answer:
To apply for asylum in Romania, you can do so directly at a border crossing point or anywhere within Romania if you have already entered the country. The application can be made verbally or in writing, after which you will submit relevant documents and attend scheduled interviews with the General Inspectorate for Immigration.

For more detailed information, please visit the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/applying-for-asylum and read the content under the "applying for asylum" section.

answers.answer:
An asylum application can be submitted directly at a border crossing point or anywhere in Romania if you have already entered the country as a migrant.

To find more detailed information, visit the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/applying-for-asylum and read the section dedicated to "applying for asylum."

answers.answer:
Applicants must submit all documents they have at their disposal that are relevant to their personal situation, as well as the document used for crossing the state border.

You can find more detailed information on applying for asylum by visiting the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/applying-for-asylum and reading the section about the asylum application process.

answers.answer:
Immediately after applying for asylum, the individual is considered an asylum seeker and cannot be deported. They will be given an asylum application form to fill out, must submit relevant documents, and will receive a temporary identity document.

To find this detailed information, visit the website dopomoha.ro/en/applying-for-asylum and read the section that describes the process after asking for asylum.
answers.bResponse:
Immediately after applying for asylum, the individual is considered an asylum seeker and cannot be deported. They will be given an asylum application form to fill out, must submit relevant documents, and will receive a temporary identity document.

To find this detailed information, visit the website dopomoha.ro/en/applying-for-asylum and read the section that describes the process after asking for asylum. For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/applying-for-asylum

answers.answer:
Yes, interviews are part of the asylum application process. You will be scheduled for a preliminary interview and a secondary interview by the General Inspectorate for Immigration (IGI) to determine a form of protection.

To find more detailed information, please visit the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/applying-for-asylum and look under the section related to "applying for asylum" or the "asylum application process".
answers.bResponse:

answers.answer:
Yes, translation is provided during asylum interviews in a language you know or are reasonably expected to know.

You can find this information on the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/applying-for-asylum under the section that describes the preliminary and secondary interviews for asylum seekers.

Asylum applications in Romania are normally processed within one to two months.

To find more detailed information, please visit the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/applying-for-asylum and read the section related to the asylum application process.

Yes, asylum seekers are protected from deportation to their country of origin from the moment they apply for asylum.

You can find this detailed information on the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/applying-for-asylum, specifically in the section that describes what happens once you are considered an asylum seeker.

Asylum seekers are provided with a temporary identity document for asylum seekers, issued by the General Inspectorate for Immigration (IGI).

To find this information on the webpage, navigate to the section that describes the process after applying for asylum, specifically where it mentions submitting documents and receiving an identification document.

answers.answer:
Sprijin de Urgență offers resources such as food, products, clothing, tents, transportation, and volunteers. It functions as a platform where individuals can either request or provide these types of support.

To find this detailed information, go to the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/applying-for-asylum and read under the section titled "Sprijin de Urgență".

answers.answer:
Un Acoperiș assists with finding temporary accommodation for vulnerable people arriving in Romania and also allows individuals to offer available spaces.

To find more detailed information, go to the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/applying-for-asylum and look under the section titled "Un Acoperiș".
